conclusion: Light rays escaping into air or entering water must not exceed the critical angle for total internal reflection.
Two blue dashed rays in the figure strike the surface exactly at the critical angle.
Measured inside the water, each of those rays makes an angle θc with the vertical normal to the surface.
The angle between the two limiting rays at the diver’s eye is α = 2θc.
For the water–air interface, Snell’s law at the critical angle gives sin θc = nair / nwater = 1 / n.
Combine α = 2θc and sin θc = 1 / n to get sin (α / 2) = 1 / n, so n = 1 / sin (α / 2).
The speed of light in water is v = C / n, where C is the speed of light in vacuum.
Substitute n = 1 / sin (α / 2) into v = C / n to get v = C sin (α / 2).
Propagation speed of light in water is v = C sin(α ⁄ 2).
